text: Brandtocetus was a genus of cetothere whales in the subfamily Cetotheriinae. Its type species is Brandtocetus chongulek from the Miocene of the Kerch Peninsula in Crimea. == Description == Brandtocetus chongulek has transversely expanded squamosal bones, S-shaped nuchal crests, an anterior margin of the occipital shield extending anterior to the center of the temporal fossa, and an elongated posterior process of the tympanoperiotic. == Related pages == * Herpetocetus * Cetotherium == References == == Other websites == Category:Baleen whales Category:Miocene Category:Crimea
title: Brandtocetus
